answerText: The Virginian: A Horseman of the Plains[10] Owen Wister, the author of The Virginian, was an author of Western fiction as was this author who wrote about Elder Tull and his pursuit of Jane Withersteen in his novel Riders of the Purple Sage.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 8 | 15 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In a pivotal scene in this novel, the protagonist shoots and kills his long-time rival, Trampas, and this work begins with a foreword "to Theodore Roosevelt." For 10 points each: [10] Identify this novel about "A Horseman of the Plains," which ends with the title character, the foreman of the Shiloh Ranch, marrying Molly Stark Wood.
